meanings.definition: Spallings (noun): small chips or fragments, especially of stone or metal
meanings.sent1: The archaeologist found ancient spallings near the excavation site.
meanings.sent2: The mason carefully collected the spallings to use in the mosaic.
meanings.sent3: The spallings on the ground looked like tiny puzzle pieces waiting to be put together.
meanings.sent4: The spallings glittered in the sunlight, resembling scattered jewels.
meanings.sent5: The spallings rattled in the bag, creating a musical sound.

meanings.definition: Spallings (verb): to break into small pieces or fragments
meanings.sent1: The hammer spallings the large rock into manageable pieces.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the old statue spallings due to weathering.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy chef managed to spallings the chocolate bar into bits all over the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The loud noise spallings the silence of the night.
meanings.sent5: The earthquake spallings the fragile vase into a thousand shards.
